ref.pp:
abbrev CloseSeq (ε : ℚ) (a b : Chapter5.Sequence) : Prop :=
  ∀ n, n ≥ a.n₀ → n ≥ b.n₀ → ε.Close (a n) (b n)

abbrev EventuallyClose (ε : ℚ) (a b : Chapter5.Sequence) : Prop :=
  ∃ N, ε.CloseSeq (a.from N) (b.from N)

signature.pp: (ε : ℚ) (a b : Sequence) : ε.CloseSeq a b ↔ ∀ n, n ≥ a.n₀ → n ≥ b.n₀ → ε.Close (a n) (b n)

ref.pp:
/-- Definition 5.2.1 ($ε$-close sequences) -/
theorem closeSeq_def (ε : ℚ) (a b : Sequence) : ε.CloseSeq a b ↔ ∀ n, n ≥ a.n₀ → n ≥ b.n₀ → ε.Close (a n) (b n) := by
  rfl

signature.pp: : (0.1 : ℚ).CloseSeq ((fun n : ℕ ↦ ((-1) ^ n : ℚ)) : Sequence) ((fun n : ℕ ↦ ((1.1 : ℚ) * (-1) ^ n)) : Sequence)

ref.pp:
/-- Example 5.2.2 -/
example :
    (0.1 : ℚ).CloseSeq ((fun n : ℕ ↦ ((-1) ^ n : ℚ)) : Sequence) ((fun n : ℕ ↦ ((1.1 : ℚ) * (-1) ^ n)) : Sequence) := by
  sorry

signature.pp: : ¬(0.1 : ℚ).Steady ((fun n : ℕ ↦ ((-1) ^ n : ℚ)) : Sequence)

ref.pp:
/-- Example 5.2.2 -/
example : ¬(0.1 : ℚ).Steady ((fun n : ℕ ↦ ((-1) ^ n : ℚ)) : Sequence) := by sorry

signature.pp: : ¬(0.1 : ℚ).Steady ((fun n : ℕ ↦ ((1.1 : ℚ) * (-1) ^ n)) : Sequence)

ref.pp:
/-- Example 5.2.2 -/
example : ¬(0.1 : ℚ).Steady ((fun n : ℕ ↦ ((1.1 : ℚ) * (-1) ^ n)) : Sequence) := by sorry

signature.pp: (ε : ℚ) (a b : Sequence) : ε.EventuallyClose a b ↔ ∃ N, ε.CloseSeq (a.from N) (b.from N)

ref.pp:
/-- Definition 5.2.3 (Eventually ε-close sequences) -/
theorem eventuallyClose_def (ε : ℚ) (a b : Sequence) : ε.EventuallyClose a b ↔ ∃ N, ε.CloseSeq (a.from N) (b.from N) :=
  by rfl

signature.pp: (ε : ℚ) (a b : ℕ → ℚ) : ε.EventuallyClose (a : Sequence) (b : Sequence) ↔ ∃ N, ∀ n ≥ N, |a n - b n| ≤ ε

ref.pp:
/-- Definition 5.2.3 (Eventually ε-close sequences) -/
theorem eventuallyClose_iff (ε : ℚ) (a b : ℕ → ℚ) :
    ε.EventuallyClose (a : Sequence) (b : Sequence) ↔ ∃ N, ∀ n ≥ N, |a n - b n| ≤ ε := by sorry

/-- Definition 5.2.6 (Equivalent sequences) -/
abbrev Equiv (a b : ℕ → ℚ) : Prop :=
  ∀ ε > (0 : ℚ), ε.EventuallyClose (a : Sequence) (b : Sequence)

signature.pp: (a b : ℕ → ℚ) : Equiv a b ↔ ∀ (ε : ℚ), ε > 0 → ε.EventuallyClose (a : Sequence) (b : Sequence)

ref.pp:
/-- Definition 5.2.6 (Equivalent sequences) -/
theorem equiv_def (a b : ℕ → ℚ) : Equiv a b ↔ ∀ (ε : ℚ), ε > 0 → ε.EventuallyClose (a : Sequence) (b : Sequence) := by
  rfl

signature.pp: (a b : ℕ → ℚ) : Equiv a b ↔ ∀ ε > 0, ∃ N, ∀ n ≥ N, |a n - b n| ≤ ε

ref.pp:
/-- Definition 5.2.6 (Equivalent sequences) -/
theorem equiv_iff (a b : ℕ → ℚ) : Equiv a b ↔ ∀ ε > 0, ∃ N, ∀ n ≥ N, |a n - b n| ≤ ε := by sorry

signature.pp:
:
  -- This proof is perhaps more complicated than it needs to be; a shorter version may be
    -- possible that is still faithful to the original text.
  Equiv (fun n : ℕ ↦ (1 : ℚ) + 10 ^ (-(n : ℤ) - 1)) (fun n : ℕ ↦ (1 : ℚ) - 10 ^ (-(n : ℤ) - 1))

ref.pp:
/-- Proposition 5.2.8 -/
theorem equiv_example :
    -- This proof is perhaps more complicated than it needs to be; a shorter version may be
      -- possible that is still faithful to the original text.
    Equiv (fun n : ℕ ↦ (1 : ℚ) + 10 ^ (-(n : ℤ) - 1)) (fun n : ℕ ↦ (1 : ℚ) - 10 ^ (-(n : ℤ) - 1)) :=
  by
  set a := fun n : ℕ ↦ (1 : ℚ) + 10 ^ (-(n : ℤ) - 1)
  set b := fun n : ℕ ↦ (1 : ℚ) - 10 ^ (-(n : ℤ) - 1)
  rw [equiv_iff]
  intro ε hε
  have hab (n : ℕ) : |a n - b n| = 2 * 10 ^ (-(n : ℤ) - 1) :=
    calc
      _ = |((1 : ℚ) + (10 : ℚ) ^ (-(n : ℤ) - 1)) - ((1 : ℚ) - (10 : ℚ) ^ (-(n : ℤ) - 1))| := rfl
      _ = |2 * (10 : ℚ) ^ (-(n : ℤ) - 1)| := by ring_nf
      _ = _ := abs_of_nonneg (by positivity)
  have hab' (N : ℕ) : ∀ n ≥ N, |a n - b n| ≤ 2 * 10 ^ (-(N : ℤ) - 1) := by intro n hn; rw [hab n]; gcongr; norm_num
  have hN : ∃ N : ℕ, 2 * (10 : ℚ) ^ (-(N : ℤ) - 1) ≤ ε :=
    by
    have hN' (N : ℕ) : 2 * (10 : ℚ) ^ (-(N : ℤ) - 1) ≤ 2 / (N + 1) :=
      calc
        _ = 2 / (10 : ℚ) ^ (N + 1) := by
          field_simp
          simp [mul_assoc, ← Section_4_3.pow_eq_zpow, ← zpow_add₀ (show 10 ≠ (0 : ℚ) by norm_num)]
        _ ≤ _ := by
          gcongr
          apply le_trans _ (pow_le_pow_left₀ (show 0 ≤ (2 : ℚ) by norm_num) (show (2 : ℚ) ≤ 10 by norm_num) _)
          convert Nat.cast_le.mpr (Section_4_3.two_pow_geq (N + 1)) using 1 <;> try infer_instance
          all_goals simp
    choose N hN using exists_nat_gt (2 / ε)
    refine ⟨N, (hN' N).trans ?_⟩
    rw [div_le_iff₀ (by positivity)]
    rw [div_lt_iff₀ hε] at hN
    grind [mul_comm]
  choose N hN using hN; use N; intro n hn
  linarith [hab' N n hn]

signature.pp: {a b : ℕ → ℚ} (hab : Equiv a b) : (a : Sequence).IsCauchy ↔ (b : Sequence).IsCauchy

ref.pp:
/-- Exercise 5.2.1 -/
theorem isCauchy_of_equiv {a b : ℕ → ℚ} (hab : Equiv a b) : (a : Sequence).IsCauchy ↔ (b : Sequence).IsCauchy := by
  sorry

signature.pp: {ε : ℚ} {a b : ℕ → ℚ} (hab : ε.EventuallyClose a b) : (a : Sequence).IsBounded ↔ (b : Sequence).IsBounded

ref.pp:
/-- Exercise 5.2.2 -/
theorem isBounded_of_eventuallyClose {ε : ℚ} {a b : ℕ → ℚ} (hab : ε.EventuallyClose a b) :
    (a : Sequence).IsBounded ↔ (b : Sequence).IsBounded := by sorry
